reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Strengthening the Humanitarian Services Through Integrated Response of Protection, Shelter/NFIs, WASH and CCCM in Mogadishu of Banadir Region.

description.narrative: This project is a integrated intervention response of around four sector areas – Protection, Shelter, WASH and Camp Coordination and Camp Management (CCCM). It is designed to reduce the risk of famine and protection consequences on the affected IDP settlements in Kahda, Dharkeylay and Deynile districts of Mogadishu. The main objective will be attained by strengthening the overall protective environment for conflict and severe drought affected populations, escalating access to basic humanitarian services linked to Protection, Shelter, WASH, and CCCM, preventing the risk of famine thereof, and addressing other interrelated protection concerns. The action Based on this grant, HINNA intends to reach 2002 HHs (12,012) beneficiaries in the target locations through adequate access to each sector. This project is intended to meet the humanitarian needs of 90% IDPs and 10% host communities who have experienced in the risk of famine and protection consequences of the total beneficiaries in the target areas. Through the selection of project beneficiaries, HINNA will employ a predetermined selection criterion in close collaboration with the line clusters and humanitarian partners in the field to avoid overlapping and in more consideration of gender mainstreaming during the design of the project activities. A priority will be given to female-headed HH, pregnant amp lactating women. HINNA will distribute NFI packages to 1015 HHs (6090) individuals from the project target areas and will establish 10 Camp Coordination Camp Management (CCCM) Committees of 80 persons = (10 X 8) in the larger IDP communities in the project target areas. They will be given camp coordination and camp management skills training of 2 sessions per 40 people of 3 days. The project will also provide GBV prevention, Response, and Capacity Building Services with GBV survivors and affected and vulnerable IDP populations and host community who are at risk of GBV and its consequences. The project will target a total number of 303 HHs (1,820 persons) including men, women, boys and girls in the project target areas – Mogadishu. HINNA, on WASH Sector, will target a total number of 670 (4,020 persons) who are suffering from poor sanitation and hygiene that may result in health risk to children and older people as well as GBV risk to women and girls while they are going to open defecations for their certain needs.
